author: GarfieldBreisig
body:
> <!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

```pwsh on Linux Ubuntu
   Paste commands into pws.  
```

## Expected behavior

```accept pasted (working) commands 

```

## Actual behavior

```Three of five Times it does not recognize valid command. It is visible on different colors for not recognized.

```It habens even with pasted '$VAR'. Not recognition of a Variable.

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```PS /home/ubuntu> $PSVERSIONTABLE

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.2
OS                             Linux 5.8.0-43-generic #49-Ubuntu SMP Fri Feb 5 03:01:28 UTC 2021
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


ubuntu@ubuntu2010:~$  lsb_release -a 
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 20.10
Release:	20.10
Codename:	groovy


Pasting a command like
$VAR = ip a
Pasting works sometimes.
Sometimes "$VAR" or "ip" are non recognized- even visibile because the color of the command is not showing.

However today I cannot reproduce it. Days before got pastin error many times

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
There's a known problem with `Set-Clipboard`, reported in #14811, i.e. with _copying_ to the clipboard, but It sounds like you're talking about _pasting_.

Please update your initial post with details of what doesn't work and more detailed information about your environment (Ubuntu version, PowerShell version), based on the issue template.

comments.author: GarfieldBreisig
comments.body:

**Pasting** a command like

           **$VAR = ip a**

Pasting works sometimes.
Sometimes "$VAR" or "ip" are non recognized- even visibile because the color of the command is not showing.

However today I cannot reproduce it. Days before got pastin error many times

title: Linux pwsh (Ubuntu). Does not work corectly with pasted commands.
